fields.description:
h3. SUMMARY
JIRA is returning 401 to webhooks from Bitbucket when using the DVCS connector integration with Easy Connect. 

h3. STEPS TO REPRODUCE
 # Integrate JIRA with Bitbucket using DVCS connector.
 # Perform a commit with commit message containing issue key.
 # Commit is not linked to the issue automatically and error 401 thrown in logs.

h3. Workaround:

To get the changes, the user can go to DVCS Accounts page and trigger a manual sync. Also, changes will appear every hour when a sync runs. 

For users that removed the integration and failed to add it back with error message "Hmm.. that didn't work". Please remove JIRA integration from *Bitbucket Settings -> Manage Integrations* from top right-hand side drop-down menu. Then, try to add again the integration.
fields.summary: JIRA is returning 401 to webhooks from Bitbucket when using the DVCS connector integration with Easy Connect

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When resizing the browser window while viewing a dashboard containing the Version Report Gadget, the gadget will occasionally fail to re-render during resize. The gadget then displays either a permissions error despite permissions being correct, or an error indicating it could not load the list of versions. The issue will persists through page refresh and logout.

h3. Environment
Google Chrome - 50.0.2661.102
Firefox - 46.0.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a dashboard and add multiple instances of the Version Report Gadget
# Configure the gadgets to render content from an existing project and version
# Resize the browser window multiple times, forcing the gadgets to re-render the version report chart

h3. Expected Results
Version Report Gadget is resized and re-rendered successfully.

h3. Actual Results
The Version Report Gadget will fail to load and will display one of the errors below.

!image-2016-05-19-16-27-59-399.png|thumbnail! 

!image-2016-05-19-16-30-07-020.png|thumbnail! 

These errors will persist through page refresh and logout. The browser development console shows HTTP 400 errors returned from JIRA during page refresh.

{code}auth-refresh.js?v=5d17277…&container=atlassian&debug=0:353 POST https://testing124.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/gadgets/makeRequest 400 (){code}

h3.Workaround
Clear the browser cache. This will allow the version report gadgets to render successfully on the next page load.
fields.summary: Version Report Gadget Resize Rendering Fails

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using a quick filter on *Agile Wallboard Gadget* does not return the right data. If you set up a quick filter to return only one issue, the gadget brings all the issues contained on the board.

h3. Environment
Cloud - JIRA v1000.217.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two Agile Projects.
# Create two Scrum boards.
# In each of projects, create two boards, each board needs a sprint.
# Create at least five issues, add these issues to the Sprint and then start it.
# In each of the board, create a quick filter, like *key = TB-1*.
# Go to the dashboard page, create a dashboard, add the gadget *Agile Wallboard Gadget* select the filter and also the board you’ve created, click on Save and you’ll see all the issues belonging to the board.

h3. Expected Results
The gadget should show only the issues related to the filter.

h3. Actual Results
The filter is not obeyed by gadget. it is bringing up all issues belonging to the board.

h3. Notes
-

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Using a quick filter on *Agile Wallboard Gadget* does not return the right data.

fields.description:
When synchronizing GitHub, the DVCS Accounts show "Sync Failed: Error during sync. See server logs":

!dvcs-sync-error.png!

In the server log, there is:
{noformat}
2014-10-13 09:31:33.264521500 2014-10-13 09:31:33,263 DVCSConnector.MessageExecutor:thread-1 ERROR ServiceRunner     [dvcs.service.message.MessageConsumer] Synchronization failed: null
2014-10-13 09:31:33.264523500 java.lang.NullPointerException
2014-10-13 09:31:33.264523500 	at java.util.AbstractCollection.addAll(AbstractCollection.java:303)
2014-10-13 09:31:33.264524500 	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.sync.GitHubPullRequestPageMessageConsumer.onReceive(GitHubPullRequestPageMessageConsumer.java:109)
2014-10-13 09:31:33.264524500 	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.sync.GitHubPullRequestPageMessageConsumer.onReceive(GitHubPullRequestPageMessageConsumer.java:29)
2014-10-13 09:31:33.264534500 	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.service.MessageExecutor$MessageRunnable.doRun(MessageExecutor.java:361)
2014-10-13 09:31:33.264535500 	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.service.MessageExecutor$ReleaseTokenAndEnqueueNextMessage.run(MessageExecutor.java:267)
2014-10-13 09:31:33.264535500 	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886)
2014-10-13 09:31:33.264537500 	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)
2014-10-13 09:31:33.264537500 	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)
{noformat}

*UPDATE* this is a bug in synchronization of GitHub/GitHub Enterprise pull requests during a full synchronization and when there are more than 30 pull requests in a repository. Commits and branches are not affected. 

*Impact* Only the oldest (by creation time) 30 pull requests in the affected repository will be synchronized. Any pull requests newer than the oldest 30 that are not updated after the time that the full sync (or first adding the GitHub account into JIRA) will not be synchronized. Any pull requests that have been changed since the full sync, regardless of whether they are among of the oldest 30, will be synchronized during a subsequent soft sync.

*Workaround* start a soft sync (just clicking on the sync icon). This would synchronize changes in the pull requests.
fields.summary: NullPointerException when synchronizing GitHub

fields.description:
*Previous Behaviour:*
Creating a link to Bitbucket from OnDemand would automatically enable the feature where commit overview in Bitbucket using a valid issue key would be displayed as a hyperlink:
!linked.jpg|thumbnail!

*Current Behaviour:*
Creating a link to Bitbucket from OnDemand links successfully with no errors reported in the logs or the package com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.  The links entry is not created automatically for the OnDemand instance and results in the following:
!not_linked.jpg|thumbnail!

*Workaround:*
You can set the link between an OnDemand instance project and a repository via Bitbucket 'cog icon' > Links > 'Add a new link' (JIRA) and adding the OnDemand instance URL.  Existing commits linking to the project will now show as a hyperlink in the Bitbucket commit overview
fields.summary: Newly linked Bitbucket accounts do not auto-create links to JIRA OnDemand for commit hyperlinks
GitHub synchronization not working and pull requests are not synchronized due to NoSuchMethodError

fields.description:
I've seen two different cases so far where OnDemand customers have been getting an error on the commits tab saying "Error rendering 'com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-bitbucket-connector-plugin:dvcs-commits-tabpanel'. Please contact your JIRA administrators.". I installed 1.2.4.2 and the error went away, but the expected commits weren't there (it says "No commits found").

We turned up the logging and checked the logs, and we came across this:

{code:none}
[bitbucket.clientlibrary.request.BaseRemoteRequestor] [REST call GET : https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/users/John Smith?oauth_signature=[...]
{code}

Notice the space in the REST URL. It's being pulled from the DVCS Connector's {{AO_E8B6CC_CHANGESET_MAPPING}} table in JIRA, which in turn was pulled from the user's {{.hgrc}}. The problem seems to have been that the user's {{.hgrc}} had his own personal details — including email address — in it, which didn't match his Bitbucket account details, and somehow this caused the DVCS Connector to get confused.

Once the user's {{.hgrc}} was fixed up with his correct details, he was able to commit and have the commits show on new issues, but the commits of any issues that had commits with the wrong user details remained empty. Looking at the database, the {{AUTHOR}} field for broken commits shows up as "John Smith", whereas once the details were correct it picked up the right Bitbucket username of "johnsmith".

I've been able to replicate this only with Mercurial repositories, Git repos seem unaffected.

*UPDATE*
This appears to affect Git repositories too, now.
fields.summary: "Username" setting in .hgrc/.gitconfig that doesn't match Bitbucket account's email address causes commits to be empty

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Some JIRA reports from project overview doesn't work which are provided by JIRA Agile. Clicking on those reports will get redirected back to the same page. The description of the reports are not rendered properly as well.

!agile_reports.png|thumbnail!

*Note:* This is only affecting customers in JIRA Cloud/OnDemand.

Access the reports directly from the Agile boards - click the "Report" tab.

If you cannot see the "Report" tab, and are unable to disable the Project Sidebar beta feature, you should still be able to access Agile Reports in the following way:

# Press they keyboard shortcut {{3}}. This will load the Agile Boards Report mode.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA Agile boards are showing other Epics tags that are not in the Sprint when the Parallel Sprint is enabled and the Swinlanes are set to Epics.
h3. Environment

Verified on JIRA Software : 1000.135.0
Not happening in: JIRA Software 1000.108.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a board with Epics
 # Enable parallel Sprints
 # Create a Sprint A and put issues on it
 # Create Sprint B and put some other issues on it.
 # Create 2 Epics, A and B
 # Put issues from Sprint A in Epic A
 # Put issues from Sprint B in Epic B
 # Start both Sprint and go to Active Sprint view.

h3. Expected Results

By switching between the Sprints, the Epic that's not related with it won't appear on it.
h3. Actual Results

The Epics not related with the Sprint selected are appearing as non-collapsible content on it.
 !epic1.png|thumbnail! 
 !epic2.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Epic names appearing in JIRA Board when Swinlane by Epic is set

fields.description:
A few customers have complained that smart commits not syncing with JIRA properly or at all. The [documentation|https://sdog.jira.com/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=87588926#HowdoestheDVCSconnectorwork?-ScheduledSynchronization] shows the service that should be running but it's not present in JIRA's services at all. The suggested fix (disable/enable) doesn't work. I've confirmed this is happening on a newly created OD instance. Manually installing the previous version does not work as the instance still shows the latest as installed.

Workaround per [~jworley]: user must resync the repo
Hold shift and click the recycle icon
Select the 'soft sync'
fields.summary: com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.scheduler.DvcsScheduler:job not installed/enabled in OD instances after upgrade

fields.description:
Hi there,

I am reporting this bug on behalf of one of our users who is blind.  Here is his issue description:

_{color:#59afe1}
"I have noticed a major accessibility regression in JIRA. I don’t need to use JIRA often, so I can’t tell you exactly when it appeared. When I access a dialog (e.g. clicking on the “Start sprint” button for an Agile project), the page becomes completely inaccessible. While the dialog is up I can only read the page title. I have tried refreshing the virtual buffer for JAWS (where the DOM is translated in to text for me to read) and restarting JAWS, but still no luck."{color}_

Can you please add tim@myplanet.com to the notification list for responses on this ticket?

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Epic Link field is not populated when 'Create issue in epic' from issue preview screen in the JIRA project view. 
This prevents tickets from being created as the 'Epic Link' field is required but cannot be entered manually. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA Software Cloud
* 7.2.0-OD-04-029

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the 'Issues' view for a software project with an Epic
# Select the 'Epic' from the issues list so that the issues is previewed to the right of the screen
# Click on the '+' to open the *Create issue in epic :* pop up dialog
# Fill in the required fields and click 'Create'

 !Screen Shot 2016-03-22 at 11.16.51 am.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* The 'Epic Link' field is populated; and
* The issue is created

h3. Actual Results
The error {color:red}Epic with key '' does not exist{color} appears and the issue cannot be created.

 !Screen Shot 2016-03-22 at 11.17.01 am.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
This does not occur when the 'create issue in epic' happens when the issue is opened outside the preview screen, so there are a few options:

# Search for the Epic issue (ICT-438 in the screenshot) to open the browse issue screen and create the 'issue in epic' from there. 
 !browse search 1.png|thumbnail!   !browse search 2.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2016-03-22 at 11.17.20 am.png|thumbnail! 
# Click on the Issue Link on the Preview window to open the issue and create the 'issue in epic' from there.
 !click link 1.png|thumbnail!    !click link 2.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2016-03-22 at 11.17.20 am.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Epic Link field is not populated when 'Create issue in epic' from issue detail view

fields.description:
*Summary*

Two transitions to the same status with different conditions. Only one should display in the sprint board, according to the condition, but both are showing up.

*Steps to Reproduce*

# Create a workflow with two statuses, e.g. _To do_ and _In Progress_.

# Set two transitions to In Progress with conditions. (e.g. One with transition with the Original Estimate field =! NULL and the other one with the Original Estimate field = NULL)

*Expected Results*

When moving an issue from _To do_ to _In Progress_ in a Sprint, you should see only one transition, according to the condition which the issue matches.


*Actual Results*

When moving an issue from _To do_ to _In Progress_ in a Sprint, you can see both transitions and when you drag the issue to the transition which does not match the condition, an error occurs:

_Can't move (issue ID). You might not have permission, or the issue is missing required information. If you keep having this problem, contact your JIRA Administrator._

*Workaround*

No workarounds.
fields.summary: Transitions that do not meet their conditions or validators appear in column

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As one sprint can appear in more than one board, deleting the sprint in board A will move its issues in board B to the  future sprint of board A. 

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create 2 new Scrum boards (A and B) - Board A should belong to project ABC and board DEF should belong to project B 
# Create a future sprint in board A (e.g Sprint A1)
# Create a future sprint in board B (e.g Sprint B1)
# Go to board A and create an issue ABC-1 and assign it to Sprint A1
# Go to Board B and create an issue DEF-1
# Edit DEF-1 and assign it to Sprint A1 - Sprint A1 should visible in board B now
# Go back to board A and create another future sprint (e.g Sprint A2)
# Drag ABC-1 to Sprint A2 
# Delete Sprint A1
# Go to board B and refresh the page
# DEF-1 now belong to Sprint A2

h3. Expected behavior
DEF-1 should be moved to Backlog

h3. Actual behavior
DEF-1 moved to the future sprint of Sprint A2

h3. Workaround
Ensure that no issues in the Sprint A1 in all boards before deleting that sprint
fields.summary: Deleting a sprint will move its issues to a future sprint of other board

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Commenting on an issue from the board preview panel and switching to another tab to submit a comment on another issue before clicking the "_Add_" button in the first tab, when changing back to the original tab the preview panel refreshes and the comment is lost.
h3. Environment
JIRA Agile Cloud version 1000.0.10-D20160705T052926

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an Agile board in the "_Active Sprints_" view
# Open the same board on another tab of your browser
# In the first tab of your browser select one of the issues in the board to open the preview panel on the right
# In the preview panel click the "_Comment_" button to add a comment in the selected issue
# Start typing the comment in the issue's comment box
# Before clicking the "_Add_" button, switch to the other tab on your browser that has the same board opened
# Select a different issue to open it in the preview panel and add a comment to this issue (by clicking the "_Comment_" button, typing the comment and clicking the "_Add_" button)
#- Or if there is a comment already on this other issue you can delete this comment or perform any other operation on this issue in the preview panel that will refresh the issue
# Switch back to the original tab where the first comment wasn't added yet

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to resume commenting on the issue or click the "_Add_" button to add the comment.
h3. Actual Results
The preview panel refreshes and the comment is lost.
 
h3.Notes
Instead of switching to another tab and comment on another issue you can also perform any other task in the board that will refresh the preview panel, like while the comment wasn't added yet, create a sub-task on this issue or transition it to another column in the board.

h3.Workaround
Don't switch to another tab or perform any other task in the board until the comment is added.
fields.summary: Comment is lost when switching tabs

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The "delete" voice is not shown in the menu for a BitBucket integration in *DVCS Accounts* in case of oauth errors: 
!01-delete-BB-connection-no-errors.png|thumbnail! 
 !02-not-possible-to-delete-if-errors.png|thumbnail! 

This is mostly the same issue reported in below bug tickets. However, this also happens in case the account is still existing but for some reason the oauth credentials are wrong:
- [JSW-14188: Renaming a BitBucket account created by OnDemand does not change the links in JIRA|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-14188]
- [JSW-14060: Deleting the OnDemand bitbucket-account does not remove the links from OnDemand JIRA|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-14060]

Administrator users should be able to delete a broken integration from DVCS Accounts. Especially if they cannot fix it.


h3. Environment
Affected version: 1000.148.2


h3. Steps to Reproduce
One way to reproduce is to delete the BitBucket account as explained in above mentioned bug tickets. 



h3. Expected Results
You have the possibility to delete the "broken" DVCS account from JIRA



h3. Actual Results
There is no "delete" voice in the menu


 

h3.Workaround
Contact support, they can remove it for you.
fields.summary: It is not possible to delete a BitBucket or Github integration in DVCS Accounts in case of oauth errors

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Managing issues on an Agile Backlog while using Chrome for iOS on an IPad Device generates a "Can't find variable" error 

h3. Environment
* JIRA v1000.285.1

Mobile Platform:
* iPad - iOS 9.5.3 (13G36) with Chrome (52.0.2743.84) 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to a JIRA Software Board Backlog 
# Drag issues from Backlog into Active Sprint

h3. Expected Results
Issues are moved without error

h3. Actual Results
Issues appear to move from Backlog into the Sprint however an error is shown on screen; message states:
{noformat}* Exception: ReferenceError: Can't find variable: fieldset
* Resource: {{URL TO BOARD}}
* Line: 3
* Column: 376
... {noformat}
 !IPadBoardError.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
- Does not appear to affect iPhones as they are loading the Mobile View of JIRA
- [Supported Browsers|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Supported+browsers] documentation indicates "Latest Stable version" of Chrome on Android and iOS is supported

h3.Workaround
Use Mobile Safari
fields.summary: "Can't Find Variable" Error on JIRA Backlog with Chrome on IPad

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Script error is shown while creating issues on board

h3. Affect Version
7.2.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Open a board
# Click on 'Create' button on top menu
# Create an issue and so the error will be shown

h3. Expected Results
A pop up containg the link of the issue is shown

fields.description:
h2. Problem Description

When viewing an issue on the board, and click on the attachments to get attachment preview. Clicking on *Show All Files* should be showing the files attached to the issue. However, it fetches attachments from other issues if the description is shown on card view and have embedded image.

!Screen Shot 2016-11-01 at 9.19.22 PM.png|thumbnail!

h2. Steps to reproduce

# On a board, create 2 different issue (Call it issue A and issue B) and attach png files to both
# On the board configuration, add description to be shown on the card 
# Then embed the png file to issue A using wiki markup on the description file
{noformat}
!<name of the png file>|thumbnail!
{noformat}
# Then view issue B's issue detail view and click on the png uploaded on step one
# Click show all files at the bottom left

h2. Expected Result

It shows only the attachment from issue B

h2. Actual Result

It include the embedded image from issue A

h2. Workaround
To remove the embedded image from issue, or alternatively remove description from showing on the card

h2. Environment information

Discovered on Cloud version {{1000.482.3}} and verified on {{1000.499.0}}
fields.summary: View All Files on the Attachments Preview fetches attachments from other issue

fields.description:
*Update from Atlassian Support:*
Viewing or accessing attachments within JIRA Cloud is returning the error:

"Ouch! We can't load the image.
/secure/attachment/path/to_file.png"

Atlassian are aware of this issue and are currently working on returning access to these attachments for all customers.

We will add an additional update once access has been restored and verified for all affected customers.

----


*Original Customer Description:*
We are facing trouble viewing the attachments uploaded in tickets, while the same attachments were reported as working properly yesterday.

For example, in ticket: https://cloud_instance.atlassian.net/browse/PROJECTKEY-1, when we try to open the attachment, we get an error mentioning:
"Ouch! We can't load the image.

/secure/attachment/25778/screenshot-1.png"

This is really important as it also affects UAT incidents where the attachments contain vital information for the resolution and we cannot view them properly.
fields.summary: Previously working attachments have ceased to work

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If Bamboo Plan gadget contains disabled plan as the first plan, the gadget cannot be shown on the Wallboard.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On Bamboo, create two plans (one build successfully, and the other disabled)
# Go to JIRA, create a blank dashboard, add Bamboo Plan gadget to the dashboard
# Put the disabled plan above the enabled one
# Tools > View as Wallboard

h3. Expected Results
Bamboo plans shoud be shown on the Wallboard

h3. Actual Results
Wallboard is showing nothing.

h3. Notes
The successful plans that added above the disabled plan will be shown on Wallboard.
fields.summary: Bamboo Plan Gadget Cannot Display on Wallboard

fields.description:
When an application link is made from JIRA OnDemand to Bamboo Server the Development panel only 3 Legged OAuth is available.

However when this is configured properly JIRA will show an error in the Development panel, as 2 legged OAuth is needed for the full functionality. However 2 Legged OAuth is not available in OnDemand.
{noformat}
JIRA is having difficulty contacting Atlassian Bamboo. If this condition persists, please contact your JIRA administrators.
{noformat}

!jirabamboo.png!

The Logs will show the following error with no further information about the error:
{noformat}
TP-Processor6 WARN sysadmin 1053x3357x5 1tl7c0a 46.243.25.78,165.254.226.130 /rest/dev-status/1.0/issue/summary [plugin.devstatus.provider.DefaultCoordinator] Requests failed: Atlassian Bamboo (java.lang.NullPointerException)
{noformat}

This will happen even if the Application Link is properly configured, and the panel at the bottom asking for the login-dance will complete correctly. No Build information will be displayed in the Development Panel however.

*Workaround*
The *Bamboo JIRA plugin* can be enabled in JIRA to display the classic Builds Tab, which will properly show linked Builds. However the Development Panel will always show the error message.
Please contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com] if the Builds tab is not enabled in your instance.
fields.summary: Development Panel displays Error for Bamboo when configured with 3-legged OAuth

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Issue span in multiple column when parent issue in backlog and subtask in other status.
Seems to also happen when an issue is appearing in the Kanban board just below a normal sub-task and there's no cards in the other columns.
h3. Environment
 * Version 7.2.0-OD-03-012

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable Kanban Backlog (lab) feature.
 # Create issue + subtask.
 # Move the sub-task issue to any other column, while keeping the parent in the Backlog column.

h3. Expected Results

Issues should not span multiple columns.
h3. Actual Results

Issues span multiple column.

!kanban.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Either one of the following can be used to workaround the problem:
 # Move the parent issue type out of the backlog, OR
 # Disable Kanban Backlog (lab) feature, OR
 # Create a quick filter {{*status != Backlog*}}
 # Quick filter {{*status not in (status1, status2, ...)*}} if you have multiple statuses in the backlog

h3. Notes

Oftentimes, disabling the Kanban Backlog Labs feature may turn the first board status as "Unmapped", removing some issues form the board.

If the Swimlanes setting in the board configuration is set to "Stories", the board will display entirely blank instead and you get an error in the Javascript console: {{TypeError: undefined is not an object (evaluating 'm.key')}} (line 175 from {{includes/js/rapid/ui/work/GridSwimlanesData.js}}).
fields.summary: Issues in Kanban span multiple columns when Backlog (Labs) is enabled

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As outlined in [Printing issue cards|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/printing-issue-cards-785332012.html], when multiple cards are selected in _Scrum backlog, Active sprints, Kanban backlog (if enabled)_, there should be an option to *Print Selected Cards*. However, the option is missing for Scrum board Backlog view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Have a board and some issues in it
# Select multiple cards -> Right click

h3. Actual Result

*Print Selected Cards* option isn't shown.

h3. Expected Result

*Print Selected Cards* option is shown.
fields.summary: Print Selected Cards option is missing from the Backlog

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Specific Project Versions not appearing in Versions sidebar menu of JIRA Software Board when the board contains too many projects being retrieved by the filter and there's no issue from this specific project in the board.

h3. Environment
JIRA Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two projects, A and B
# Create versions in Project A and B
# Create issues in project A
# Create a board with no specific filter: ORDER BY ASC for example
# Verify the "Versions" panel.

h3. Expected Results
Versions from both projects should appear in the board's Version panel

h3. Actual Results
The versions from Project B won't show up, since there's no issues from Project B appearing in the board.
 
h3. Notes
Epic Issues are not being considered in this case, so, if there's Epics from the Project B, the Versions won't show up anyway.

h3.Workaround
Create a dummy issue for the project B
fields.summary: Project Versions not appearing in Versions sidebar menu of JIRA Software Board

fields.description:
h3. Summary

We can drag the sprint footer to include or exclude issues from sprint.
When we drag the sprint footer to remove a issue and add it back again without losing the click/drag the estimate turns to 0

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On an Agile board , create few issues with estimates.
# Create a sprint and add two issues from the backlog
# Drag the footer to exclude one issue from the sprint then add it again without losing the drag

h3. Expected Results

Correct estimates should be calculated
 

h3.Workaround
Refresh the page
fields.summary: Agile sprint drag makes estimate as 0 when an issue is removed and added in a single drag

fields.description:
DVCS connector is not passing value for pagelength properly if it is not set causing DVCS Connector can no longer fetch pull requests. It tries to make the following call during synchronization:

https://bitbucket.org/!api/2.0/repositories/[username]/[repoName]/pullrequests/[prNumber]/comments?pagelen=0

Which returns a 400 bad request with the message that the value for pagelen is invalid. Changing the value to something greater than 0 works.
fields.summary: DVCS connector is not passing value for pagelength properly if it is not set

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On a Kanban/Scrum Board, 'Ctrl' (cmd) + click on the issue key does not open the issue on a new tab.

h3. Environment

JIRA v1000.769.0
JIRA Agile v1000.324.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a board
# Hold Ctrl (Cmd on Mac) and click on a issue key.

h3. Expected Results

The issue is opened in a new tab.

h3. Current Results

The URL is updated on the browser but no tab is opened.


h3.Workaround

If you're using a 'mouse', you can "Scroll click" on the issue key instead.
fields.summary: Regression on cmd + click on issue key to open issue in new tab on Agile board (Active sprints/Kanban board)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In JIRA Cloud, if using Decimal values as the estimate time for the Agile Cards, the Story Points estimate will not respect it, displaying the number without the decimal content there. 

 

In summary, we can no longer see decimals in estimates on the backlog or active sprint screens:

 

!estimate.png|thumbnail!

 

 Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Scrum board.
 # Add issues to the board and go to the *Active Sprints* part, in the left hand panel of the project.
 # Set an estimate for the issue (using decimal numbers. e.g. 0.5)

h3. Expected Results

Having the Story Point displaying the estimate respecting the decimal numbers. Not being different.
h3. Actual Results

The estimate on the backlog/active sprints is not respecting the decimal order. Only using the complete number.
h3. Workaround

 There's no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Story Points are not Being Displayed as Decimal Values in Agile Cards

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

Attachment is added in the wrong issue when the uploading isn't complete and user clicks on a different issue.

h3. Step to Reproduce

# Have a board and 2 issues
# Go to Backlog view
# Click issue-1 until the Issue Details panel open
# Attach big file attachment (ie. 9Mb)
# While it's uploading, click the second issue and wait until the attachment is uploaded.

h3. Actual Result

The attachment is added to the second issue.

h3. Expected Result

The attachment is added to the first issue.
fields.summary: Attachment added in the wrong issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When accessing Agile Boards a 500 error is displayed.
On some cases the backlog does not show up (is blank).

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud
 
h2. Workaround
The fix for this issue is being deployed. A workaround can be applied by Atlassian support in case you cannot wait for the fix to reach your instance.
fields.summary: Internal Server Error when trying to access boards or backlog.

fields.description:
Issues moved to a sprint appear in a different order once the page is refreshed.

 

 

---

Original summary
{quote}Dragging the first issue to a sprint does not update its rank properly
{quote}
Original description
{quote}When you drag-and-drop the first issue in a sprint, the ranking is not updated.
Then when you start adding more issues to that sprint, all these issues will "clump" around the first issue's original raking.
This also happens if you use the "+ Create issue" button at the bottom of the sprint to create the first issue of this sprint.

End result is that sometimes the ranking of issues viewed via a filter result page does not look like what you see on a board's backlog view.

We have people (tech writers, managers) looking at issue priorities with via filter result pages or dashboards. It's very difficult and time consuming to have to manually groom the issue ranking to "mimic" the board's backlog view.
{quote}
fields.summary: Issue rank in a sprint may change after page refresh

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using sprint planning screen on the boards of JIRA, the layout of the issues show different than the normal.

h3. Environment

*Cloud environment
*JIRA Cloud Version: 7.2.0-OD-02-009


h3. Steps to Reproduce
This happens when you click on backlog, and click again on the sprint planning, also if you open the issues detail view the issues view on the left side are changed too. This makes me believe that this is a length problem due to the name of the issues and the epic label extend too much the field to view the issue, although since when you hit F5 on the sprint planning view the issues is fixed, I believe this is a bug. 


h3. Expected Results

The issues view should be displayed with a slim view like on the screenshot provided

h3. Actual Results

The issue view occupy the size of two issues

h3. Notes
No Notes

h3.Workaround
Hit F5 on the planning screen and the issues view return to normal

You can see the screenshot attached for more details.
fields.summary: Issues Layout on sprints are displayed unformatted

fields.description:
When a post commit hook is added to the Bitbucket services, commit messages does not appear in JIRA issues itself. This has been occurring intermittently with a number of customer's instances in OnDemand.

Initial investigation has led me to a few cases:
* The first was here (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/DCON-51), where it seems the connector is not causing the problem and thus, the issue was tracked in the Bitbucket project.
* A ticket was created in the Bitbucket project here (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BB-1998), which underline the difficulty of the bug that is occurring in Bitbucket. The developer has looked into this and thus, created a bug report in Bitbucket itself for tracking.
* Over here (https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/2636/post-service-does-not-post-again) is where the actual problem is being tracked; after some time, the case has been resolved with no outputs on what was being done in the backend.

This bug is quite dated (resolved in June 2011); but the problem is recurring.

Any takes on this matter?
fields.summary: Intermittent Behaviour of Post Commit Hooks in Connector

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Time-out errors when releasing a large amount of issues from a Kanban board

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a board with >100 unreleased issues;
# click *Release...*;
# fill in the required fields in the dialog displayed and click *Release*.

h3. Expected Results
Issues are released and new *Version* is created.


h3. Actual Results
The release takes a long time due to the number of issues and a time-out error is displayed.

h3. Notes
The error is only at the UI level, though, and the operation continues in the back end. The new Version is created and released, and all issues are updated as expected. Refreshing the board will confirm that - released issues are no longer visible.

h3.Workaround
Refreshing the board should confirm that released issues are no longer visible.

(i) Ensure the board is set to filter out issues that already have a released fixVersion set by configuring the _Kanban board sub-filter_ with:
{code:borderStyle=solid} 
fixVersion in unreleasedVersions() OR fixVersion is EMPTY
{code}
fields.summary: Timeout errors when releasing a large amount of issues from a Kanban board in Cloud

fields.description:
*UPDATE*: This bug happens when synchronizing against a GitHub repo that has at least one issue that is not a pull request and has comments.

When synchronizing with GitHub, if a GitHub issue does not have an associated pull request (such as [this one|https://github.com/rapid7-cookbooks/nexpose/issues/5]), a NPE is thrown and the synchronization fails.

{code}
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.sync.IssueCommentPayloadEventProcessor.process(IssueCommentPayloadEventProcessor.java:42)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.spi.github.service.impl.GitHubEventProcessorAggregatorImpl.process(GitHubEventProcessorAggregatorImpl.java:104)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.service.GitHubEventServiceImpl$1.doInTransaction(GitHubEventServiceImpl.java:120)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.service.GitHubEventServiceImpl$1.doInTransaction(GitHubEventServiceImpl.java:99)
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.transaction.HostContextTransactionTemplate$1.doInTransaction(HostContextTransactionTemplate.java:25)
	at com.atlassian.jira.DefaultHostContextAccessor.doInTransaction(DefaultHostContextAccessor.java:34)  <+2>
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
{code}

See https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/jira-bitbucket-connector/src/6d8ef9f36aa620f3f0f8faf44652b6654aaacc52/jira-dvcs-connector-plugin/src/main/java/com/atlassian/jira/plugins/dvcs/sync/IssueCommentPayloadEventProcessor.java?at=jira-dvcs-connector-parent-2.0.2#cl-42

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, the burnup chart (labs) takes into account decimals when adding up Work Scope, but Completed Work does not recongnize story points estimated with decimals. For example, if a user estimates a task will require 0.5 story points, and the task is completed, the completed work in the burnup chart will be reported as 0. 1.5 will be reported as 1. And on.

h3. Environment
This feature is currently in labs.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a scrum board and add a sprint with multiple tasks/stories.
# Before starting the sprint, add estimates with decimals, such as 0.5 story points, 1.5, etc.
# Start sprint and complete all issues / move to done column.
# Open the burnup report. Report will not show decimals or even recognise them, so no rounding takes place.

h3. Expected Results
Story points should be reported with decimals.

h3. Actual Results
Attached screenshots show that the Completed Work column currently does not recognise the story points.
 
h3.Workaround
None at the moment
fields.summary: Burnup Chart not taking decimal story points into account

fields.description:
As noted in [Lexorank support Tools page | https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/GHDEV/LexoRank+Support+Tools]:
{quote}
A rebalance will start (within a minute) and complete the failed balance, majority of issues with long rank values will be rebalanced. At this point there may still be issues with long rank fields, and a second re-balance may be required. After the completion of a second rebalance, the rank system will enable ranking operations.
{quote}

I many cases the Rank Rebalance does not Occur, and the {{max_rank_string_length}} value increases causing high CPU load on the system whenever an issue with a large value is referenced, either in an agile board or the ticket directly, in many cases leading to a System outages due to load.
If a timeout occurs you will see the following in the logs:
{code}
[greenhopper.customfield.lexorank.LexoRankIndexer] Could not retrieve LexoRank value for issue[id=jiraIssueID]. Indexing max LexoRank value instead.
{code}
Majority of the time no indication of the issue are visible until timeout occurs.

h1.UPDATE:
We have been able to narrow this down to the following two conditions:
- {{max_rank_string_length}} is high
- Number of issues in Agile {{field_id}} Also HIGH

When both of these values are at increased levels the performance hit occurs until the max rank value is balanced.
- EXE. a heavily used Agile Board

h1.Workaround:

Follow the steps in this [Knowledge Base Article| https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ONDEMANDKB/Agile+Boards+are+Taking+a+Long+Time+to+Load].
fields.summary: Performance Degradation Caused by Rank Values

fields.description:
When work is logged against an issue via a transition screen, the RTE change isn't recorded in the Sprint burndown report/table.
 Example of issue ABC-2 that's been added to sprint and has work logged against it in the same minute:
 !work-logged-and-sprint-set-in-same-minute.png!
 Expected result in burndown report:
 !expected-burndown-report.png!
 Actual result:
 !actual-burndown-report.png!
 Note the missing row for "Work logged" and the values in the "Time Spent" columns.


 *Steps to reproduce:*
 # Make a scrum board.
 # Configure the board to have time tracking. Board > Configure > Estimation and pick "Remaining Estimate and Time Spent":
 !enable-time-tracking-in-estimation.png!
 # Add the "Log Work" field to the board's issue screen. You can do this from the edit dialog of an issue > Configure fields > Where is my field and adding "Log Work" to the screen.
 !where-is-my-field.png!
 # Go back to the board and create a sprint.
 # Add an issue to the sprint and give it a remaining time estimate (60m in my screenshot).
 # Do this in the same minute of the clock: start the sprint and log work for the issue (10m in my screenshot).
 # Check the Burndown chart for this sprint. You should see that the "log work" entry is missing from the report.
 I suspect this is caused somewhere in BurndownChangeUtil.java when we get the changes per issue. If that's the case, make sure all the charts/reports involved are also checked.

Context: [https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-217975].
fields.summary: Sprint burndown chart does not include work logged or time spent

fields.description:
Customers trying to setup a new connection to GitHub are unable to connect, receiving and Error: Invalid user/team account.

The reason for this is due to rate-limiting that GitHub has in place. Un-authenticated requests are limited to 1 per second per IP address over a 1 minute period. Outbound connections in OnDemand share squid proxies. There are two per rack meaning that approximately 1000 instances share a single outbound IP.

During busy periods, the rate limit means that customers are seeing error pages when they enable Github DVCS connector syncing.

We need to adjust the DVCS connector so that it takes account of this fact.

EDIT - If you are seeing this issue please raise a ticket at https://support.atlassian.com and we can investigate and see if a workaround is available for your instance.
fields.summary: Unable to link to GitHub due to Invalid user/team account error

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Sprint Burndown Gadget not displaying the graphic lines when being viewed as wallboard and when it is not in the first screen to be displayed.
Reproducible on Google Chrome but not Safari.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new dashboard.
# Select Edit Layout and Choose the first option (full screen display).
# Add the Sprint Burndown gadget.
#* You must have a open sprint.
# Add the Assigned to me gadget.
#* It seems to be reproducible with any gadget, the assigned to me is just one gadget that you can use to reproduce the bug.
# Select Tools > View as Wallboard.
# The Sprint Burndown gadget will be the second gadget to be displayed but it will be empty.

h3. Expected Results
The Sprint Burndown Gadget will display graphic lines showing the data get from the sprint.

h3. Actual Results
The Sprint Burndown Gadget display a empty graphic.

!198921b.png|thumbnail!


 
h3. Notes
- Tested on JIRA v7.1.0-OD-01-053 but the gadget is not working on this version either.
- Tested on Chrome Version 50.0.2661.94, it is working on Safari.


h3.Workaround
Use Safari instead of Google Chrome.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

At this moment, Time Tracking report will only show issues based on certain version. As a user, I'd like to have this report to display issues for each Sprint.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to have Time Tracking report for each Sprint.
fields.summary: Time Tracking report for each Sprint

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Creating a ticket under one project and adding a different sprint to the Sprint field, makes the sprints cross and the information is removed from the sprint.

I was in one of my boards when I created an issue, however, this new ticket wasn’t added into the sprint. I then clicked on the Edit button and added the sprint 1 into the Sprint field. Somehow the sprint boards got crossed. My sprint’s name changed, the time remaining changed, and all of my sprint tickets were removed from the sprint. The only remaining tickets in the sprint was the existing tickets that were added to sprint 1.

h3. Suggestion
Provide an option to not cross sprints when a ticket is added to a new sprint.

h3. Workarounds
None
fields.summary: Sprints crossed

The following terms used: TimeSpent = resolutionDate-created On SIL script

Results: TimeSpent=16h 30m \- this results I do not want

Therefore, it is possible to work a certain set time? How do I determine how this matter? Help :)
